excerpt: Binoculars are recommended at this viewing platform for observing Kanchenjunga & surrounding hills.
detail_description: Tashi View Point, built by the King of Sikkim, Tashi Namgyal, holds historical significance and offers a mesmerizing view of Mt. Kanchenjunga. It is an ideal spot to witness the sunrise and enjoy the panoramic beauty as the sun sets over Kanchenjunga and Siniolchu peaks. The viewpoint is located 8 km from Gangtok and provides a peaceful escape from urban development.
name: Tashi View Point
address: Gangtok, Sikkim 737107, India

excerpt: Quaint Hindu temple with sweeping hilltop views, plus a cafe offering drinks & light bites.
detail_description: Ganesh Tok is a charming Hindu temple located about 7 km from Gangtok, offering breathtaking panoramic views of the sprawling city and the majestic Himalayan landscape. From this elevated ridge, visitors can marvel at the snow-capped peaks of Mt. Khangchendzonga and Mt. Siniolchu, creating an awe-inspiring backdrop to the picturesque city below.
name: Ganesh Tok
address: 8JRC+HGM, Jawaharlal Nehru Rd, Sungava, Gangtok, Sikkim 737103, India

excerpt: Colorful, Army-maintained Hindu temple complex with dramatic valley & mountain views.
detail_description: Hanuman Tok is a renowned Hindu temple complex in Gangtok, maintained by the Indian Army. Positioned at an elevation of 7200 feet, it provides breathtaking views of the majestic Mt Kanchenjunga peak and the surrounding hills. The temple holds religious significance and is believed to fulfill the wishes of its devotees. Its captivating beauty, lush greenery, and clear blue skies make it a must-visit for both locals and tourists exploring Gangtok.
name: Hanuman Tok
address: 8JXH+4FP, Gangtok, Sikkim 737103, India

excerpt: Museum, library & research venue devoted to Tibetan culture, with statues, scrolls & ritual objects.
detail_description: The Namgyal Institute of Tibetology, established in 1958, is a museum, library, and research venue dedicated to Tibetan culture. Housed in a traditional Tibetan-style building, it boasts one of the largest collections of Tibetan works outside of Tibet.
name: Namgyal Institute of Tibetology
address: 8J83+9WF, Deorali Rd, M.P.Golai, Tadong, Gangtok, Sikkim 737101, India

excerpt: Secluded, colorful Tibetan Buddhist monastery dating to 1908, standing on a hill above Gangtok.
detail_description: Perched on a hill above Gangtok, Enchey Monastery is a vibrant Tibetan Buddhist site established in 1908. Alongside other revered monasteries like Rumtek, Ranka, Tashiding, Tsuk La Khang, and Pemayangste in the area, it holds great spiritual significance. Visitors seeking soulful experiences are drawn to this serene sanctuary for its breathtaking views of Gangtok and the majestic Kanchenjunga peak.
name: Enchey Monastery
address: 8JP9+9MF, Gangtok, Sikkim 737103, India

excerpt: Large hilltop Buddhist temple with a golden-domed stupa, elaborate shrines & engraved prayer wheels.
detail_description: Do Drul Chorten is a significant Buddhist stupa located in Gangtok, Sikkim. Built in 1945 by Trulshik Rinpoche, it features an impressive golden-domed stupa and around 108 prayer wheels engraved with mantras. The site also houses religious texts and objects. Situated near the Institute of Tibetology, this serene locale offers visitors the chance to explore Buddhist sites and monasteries.
name: Do Drul Chorten
address: 8J73+4WP, M.P.Golai, Tadong, Gangtok, Sikkim 737102, India

excerpt: Peaceful Buddhist monastery known for its vibrant, decorative facade & charming hillside locale.
detail_description: Pal Karma Zurmang Shedup Chokhor Ling Lingdum Monastery, also known as Ranka Monastery, is a serene Buddhist monastery located about 20 km from Gangtok in East Sikkim. The monastery features traditional Tibetan architecture and is renowned for its vibrant frescoes, hand paintings, Thankas, and the lively Lama Mask dance performed by the monks during the Losar festival.
name: Pal Karma Zurmang Shedup Chokhor Ling Lingdum Monastery (Ranka Monastery)
address: 8HJH+FJF, Lingdum, Sikkim 737135, India

detail_description: The Flower Exhibition Centre - Ridge Park, located in Gangtok, is a paradise for nature lovers. It showcases flora from diverse parts of Sikkim under one roof and is a must-visit destination. The center hosts an annual flower show from April to May, featuring a stunning display of orchids and other flowers from the region.
name: Flower Exhibition Centre - Ridge Park.
address: 8JJ8+MG7, Arithang, Gangtok, Sikkim 737111, India

excerpt: Sprawling zoological park with select animals, a watchtower & views of Mount Khangchendzonga.
detail_description: Nestled in a sprawling 230-hectare forested hill, Sikkim Himalayan Zoological Park is a haven for nature and wildlife enthusiasts. The park is home to various animals including the adorable Red Panda, Bengal tigers, black panthers, Himalayan Black Bears, Clouded Leopards, and more. Visitors can explore the fenced areas on foot or opt for a half-day car tour. Additionally, the park offers stunning views of Mount Khangchendzonga.
name: Sikkim Himalayan Zoological Park
address: Jawaharlal Nehru Rd, Sungava, Gangtok, Sikkim 737103, India

excerpt: Natural waterfall rushing down rocks into a small pool, viewable by a modest footbridge.
detail_description: Bakthang Waterfall is a hidden gem in East Sikkim, offering a serene and less touristy experience compared to other attractions. Located just an hour's drive from Gangtok, this natural wonder originates from the river Ratey Chu and cascades down against the backdrop of the Eastern Himalayas. The roaring sound of the waterfall can be heard from a distance, adding to its allure. Surrounded by dense vegetation, it provides an ideal setting for a peaceful picnic.
name: Bakthang Waterfall
address: 9J5F+4CF, Gangtok, Sikkim 737103, India

excerpt: Gangtok is the capital of the mountainous northern Indian state of Sikkim. Established as a Buddhist pilgrimage site in the 1840s, the city became capital of an independent monarchy after British rule ended, but joined India in 1975. Today, it remains a Tibetan Buddhist center and a base for hikers organizing permits and transport for treks through Sikkimâ€™s Himalayan mountain ranges.
detail_description: Gangtok, the capital of Sikkim, is a city with a rich history as a Buddhist pilgrimage site and an independent monarchy. It's now known as a Tibetan Buddhist center and serves as a hub for hikers planning treks through the Himalayan mountain ranges of Sikkim. The city offers various tour packages to explore its surroundings, including Darjeeling, Kalimpong, Pelling, and more.
name: Gangtok
address: Sikkim, India

detail_description: Ban Jhakri Falls Park is a captivating sightseeing destination spread over two acres of land, located about 10-12 kilometers from Gangtok en route to Ranka monastery. The main attraction is the waterfall, which tumbles down from a rocky height of approximately 40 feet with great force. The park features beautifully landscaped gardens adorned with statues depicting the local culture and ancestors.
name: Ban Jhakri Falls Park
address: Gangtok, Sikkim 737101, India

detail_description: White Hall, located in Gangtok, is a significant historical site renowned for its distinctive British architectural style. Erected in honor of Sikkim's inaugural political officer, the memorial serves as a poignant reminder of bygone times. The building is set amidst picturesque gardens, providing visitors with a tranquil and serene atmosphere to explore and reflect upon its rich heritage.
name: White Hall
address: Ridge Rd, Arithang, Gangtok, Sikkim 737101, India

detail_description: This was my inaugural journey with Thrillophilia and a group of strangers. I must admit that Thrillophilia lived up to its reputation (no one is flawless, so it's important to be adaptable when facing minor hiccups). The entire trip proceeded seamlessly, commencing with the airport pickup, accommodations received, permits arranged, sightseeing expeditions, and finally drop-off at the airport.
name: North Sikkim Tour
address: Burtuk Rd, Burtuk, Gangtok, Sikkim 737101, India

detail_description: The Thakurbari Temple in Gangtok, Sikkim is a significant pilgrimage site and one of the oldest Hindu temples in the state. It was built on land donated by the Chogyal of Sikkim in 1935 and houses idols of major deities. The temple's serene atmosphere and beautiful architecture make it a must-visit spot for travelers exploring Gangtok.
name: Shri Thakurbari Temple, Gangtok
address: 8JJ7+27W, Mahatma Gandhi Marg, Arithang, Gangtok, Sikkim 737101, India

detail_description: Tsuklakhang, also known as Chogyal Palace, is a significant landmark in Gangtok with historical importance. While it's no longer accessible to the public, its grandeur can still be admired from Ganesh Tok. This palace holds a crucial role in Sikkim's history as it played a part in the state's merger with India in 1975. Its rich historical significance makes it an intriguing site for visitors interested in the region's past.
name: Tsuklakhang / Chogyal Palace
address: 8JG7+CRX, Secretariat Rd, Near Secretariat, Vishal Gaon, Gangtok, Sikkim 737101, India

detail_description: Tsuglakhang Monastery & Temple, also known as Tsuklakhang Palace or Tsuklakhang Royal Chapel and Monastery, is a magnificent Buddhist palatial monastery located in Gangtok, Sikkim, India. This royal chapel has been the center for prayers and ceremonies for the Chogyals, featuring an assembly hall and a vast collection of Buddhist scriptures and literature.
name: Tsuglakhang Monastery & Temple
address: 8JG7+CVX, Secretariat Rd, Vishal Gaon, Gangtok, Sikkim 737101, India

detail_description: "Udaan Silk Route Tours & Travels" offers well-organized tours to Nathula Pass, also known as the Silk Route. The pass is located 57 km away from Gangtok and boasts stunning snow-covered scenery. The agency provides proper guidance, well-maintained cars, punctual service, and friendly drivers. Clients have praised the comfortable and luxurious tour packages offered at reasonable prices.
name: Udaan Silk Route Tours & Travels
address: Mahatma Gandhi Marg, above Axis bank, opposite Bata, Arithang, Gangtok, Sikkim 737101, India

detail_description: Experience the breathtaking views of Gangtok by taking a ride on the Ropeway, also known as a cable car. With three terminal stations to choose from, this aerial journey offers mesmerizing vistas of the town and its surrounding valleys. The well-maintained cable cars ensure safety and comfort for up to 20 passengers at a time. Offering an opportunity to capture stunning photographs, this attraction provides an unforgettable experience within the city.
name: Ropeway
address: Syari Rd, Deorali Bazar, Gangtok, Sikkim 737102, India

name: Guide Sikkim Tour & Travels
address: Sisa Golai Sisa Golai, Gangtok, Sikkim 737101, India
